186 - 02 Jan 2024 02:04PM - Austin: Let me please help you with the financial aspects of the program.  *Cost of education* The cost of education is reduced from $6000-$8000 to $2000-$3000 per annum which includes Tuition fees, Accommodation, Food, Wifi, Laundry, Library fee etc. It is paid in two equal instalments, each instalment before a semester. This cost can be further reduced by you through the earnings from Earn While You Learn program  *Enrollment fee* For all the services and assistance including Applications to Universities, Statement of Purpose, Visa Documentation Assistance, University Selection and sessions, Earn While you Learn program and training, etc all you have is $350 which can either be paid in two phases($200 in 7 days and remaining within the next 30 days) or together
187 - 02 Jan 2024 02:04PM - Austin: *Registration Fee* The registration fee($500-$750) is to be paid after you receive the Offer letter from University after the University sessions and then you receive the Admission Acceptance Letter.  *The registration fee isn't an additional fee as it is waived from the cost of education.*  For example, if your cost of education after the scholarship is $2200 per annum and the registration fee is $600, then while you are in India you need to pay only the remaining amount which is $2200-600= $1600  The cost of transportation and visa application is catered by a student's family

Please elaborate on your understanding of the Earn While you Learn program in 75-100 words.  Earn is the backbone of Edoofa. It helps students to learn skills necessary for the work space environment. It helps a student make education affordable. Earn  has no limit to which a student can earn scholarship credit depending on the amount of work and effort you put. Earn can help students reduce their fees. Earn helps a student to keep up with the changing market strategies and needs, promising a better future. Earn has been recognized by a lot of market leaders eg Africa Global Radio to create a strong hold in the market. Earn creates opportunities for edoofians to get a start in their professional journey.  7. After receiving your offer letter from the University, you will have to pay your registration fee in order to finalize your university selection and reserve your scholarship seat in a particular university, this registration fee would be adjusted in your first year's annual fee, therefore, it is a part of your first year's annual fee after scholarship. 154 - 02 Jan 2024 12:42PM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA* is a 3-year professional undergraduate course in Business Management. BBA course equips you with the right knowledge and skills in business and management and impart knowledge of the principles which are perfect for a career in the corporate world. A degree in Business Administration solidifies your base for your future Business and management career goals. Successful graduates of this course can opt for a range of jobs from sectors like human resource, finance, marketing, sales, management, government, and education.  Financial Analyst, Real Estate Management, Operation Management, Business Development Executive, Project Manager (IT), Data Analyst, Human Resources (HR) Manager Supply Chain Manager, Production Manager, Marketing Executive etc. are some such profiles which successful graduates interested in pursuing a job can opt for.  *What is BBA about?*  *Bachelor of Business Administration* is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on ones preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  *BBA* degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills   *Bachelor of Business Administration* course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students. The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.  The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  *BBA* course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few.  Some of the major job profiles associated with BBA degree are as follows:  *Financial Analyst* *Production Manager* *Operations Team Leader* *Business Development Executive* *Real Estate Management* *Project Manager (IT)* *Data Analyst* *Human Resources (HR) Manager* *Marketing Executive*

196 - 02 Jan 2024 01:36PM - Garima Edoofa: Jerome basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*

47 - 02 Jan 2024 01:45PM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA* is a 3-year professional undergraduate course in Business Management. BBA course equips you with the right knowledge and skills in business and management and impart knowledge of the principles which are perfect for a career in the corporate world. A degree in Business Administration solidifies your base for your future Business and management career goals. Successful graduates of this course can opt for a range of jobs from sectors like human resource, finance, marketing, sales, management, government, and education.  Financial Analyst, Real Estate Management, Operation Management, Business Development Executive, Project Manager (IT), Data Analyst, Human Resources (HR) Manager Supply Chain Manager, Production Manager, Marketing Executive etc. are some such profiles which successful graduates interested in pursuing a job can opt for.  *What is BBA about?*  *Bachelor of Business Administration* is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on ones preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  *BBA* degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills   *Bachelor of Business Administration* course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students. The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.  The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  *BBA* course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few.  Some of the major job profiles associated with BBA degree are as follows:  *Financial Analyst* *Production Manager* *Operations Team Leader* *Business Development Executive* *Real Estate Management* *Project Manager (IT)* *Data Analyst* *Human Resources (HR) Manager* *Marketing Executive*

106 - 02 Jan 2024 12:39PM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their clients perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative. *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on  going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are: *Good Written Communication* Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency. *Good Verbal Communication* A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law. *Good Time Management* In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential. *A great degree of self-confidence* This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases. *An analytical mind and good research skills* A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success. *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)* Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic. *Tech Savvy* In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success. *Good Commercial awareness* This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally. *A high degree of patience* This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling. *Team player skills* Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information though networking and working with people helps in attaining the objectives.

41 - 02 Jan 2024 03:57PM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor of Arts or BA in Travel and Tourism Management* is a 3-year undergraduate course designed for students who wish to study travel and tourism management in detail.  This course is designed for those individuals who wish to make a bright future in the tourism sector.  B.A in Travel and Tourism Management course is of great importance since the sector needs smart, young personalities who can handle their firm in a positive stride. After successful completion of the course, students can become Travel Agents, Tour Guides, Airline staff, Travel Executive and can opt for many other job roles  BA in Travel and Tourism Management involves an in-depth study of travel and tourism management. Students are taught development of tourism and marketing. All necessary skills that can qualify him to be travel planner or tour guide are studied.  Candidates are imparted knowledge regarding transportation industry, hotel management and tourist resort planning. In the duration of the course, they also learn skills like Food Service Management, Intercultural Communication, Ecology, Environment and client servicing. All these subjects are the foundation skills for any student who wish to make a bright career after pursing BA in Travel and Tourism Management course.  Students who wish to study BA in Travel and Tourism Management course must consider the points mentioned below:  They must possess a charming and welcoming personality. They should have excellent communication skills so as to relay the information regarding the monuments, tourist places and other destinations to the observers and visitors. They should have a welcoming attitude and present the information in the best possible way. They should also have a wide horizon of knowledge so as to accommodate various names, years and information of places in their mind. They should be able to relay the information orally if they wish to become tourist guides.  After successful completion of the course, candidates can find ample job opportunities in many fields. At the least, they can become tourist guides and start by initially working in their own area or city or state. They can join Tourism Department of India and apply with this degree.  Also, they can accompany the senior tour guides and learn from them how to conduct events and explore cities.  Students of BA in Travel and Tourism Management can also work in travel agencies where they accompany the passengers in exploring various places and cities. They can work at top notch hotels of India and be the host for various clients. All and all, BA Travel and Tourism Management graduates have a bright and hustling career ahead.

265 - 28 Dec 2023 06:52PM - +260 97 1142911: TEST Section 1:  NAME:  Beenzu Chilumba GENDER:  Female D.O.B:       31/10/2007 FATHER'S NAME: Siatoongo Chilumba MOTHER'S NAME: Mercy Wamusheke EMAIL ADDRESS: beenzuchilu16@gmail.com PARENT'S EMAIL ADDRESS: mercywamusheke103@gmail.com COURSE: Bachelor of Nutrition and Dietetics INTAKE YEAR: 2024 COUNTRY: ZAMBIA  SECTION 2 1.C 2.C 3.A 4.B 5.B  SECTION 3  6.D 7.A 8.C 9.C  SECTION 4 10. D 11.A 12.B 13.C 14.B 15.A 16.B  SECTION 5  Life in Rwanda, 16 years after the genocide, reflects a complex narrative of resilience, reconciliation, and reconstruction. The aftermath of the 1994 genocide left an indelible mark on the nation, its people, and the global conscience. The subsequent years have witnessed remarkable transformations, challenging perceptions of the country and inspiring hope for a better future.  Rwanda's journey from the depths of despair to its present state is a testament to the strength of its people and visionary leadership. The genocide, which claimed nearly a million lives in just 100 days, shattered the social fabric of the nation. Families were torn apart, communities devastated, and trust obliterated. However, the post-genocide era has been defined by a collective commitment to healing and rebuilding.  One of the most striking aspects of life in Rwanda today is the emphasis on unity and reconciliation. The government, under the leadership of President Paul Kagame, has implemented policies that prioritize national unity over ethnic divisions. The divisive ethnic identities of Hutu, Tutsi, and Twa have been downplayed in favor of a more inclusive Rwandan identity. This deliberate effort to foster unity has played a crucial role in rebuilding trust among the population.  The Gacaca courts, a community-based justice system, were established to address the overwhelming number of genocide-related cases. This innovative approach sought not only to bring perpetrators to justice but also to promote truth-telling and reconciliation. While the Gacaca courts faced challenges and criticisms, they represented a unique attempt to navigate the complexities of justice and reconciliation in the aftermath of such a traumatic event.  Economically, Rwanda has experienced significant growth and development. The government has implemented policies to attract foreign investment, promote entrepreneurship, and diversify the economy. The capital, Kigali, has transformed into a hub of innovation and technology, earning the nickname "the Singapore of Africa." Infrastructure development, including the construction of roads and the expansion of the Kigali International Airport, has further facilitated economic progress.  Education has been a focal point for the government, recognizing the role it plays in shaping the future of the nation. Efforts to improve access to education and promote inclusivity have resulted in increased enrollment and literacy rates. The emphasis on education also extends to the remembrance and understanding of the genocide, ensuring that younger generations are aware of their history.  Despite these positive changes, challenges persist. The psychological scars of the genocide run deep, and the process of reconciliation is ongoing. Many survivors and perpetrators continue to grapple with the trauma, and the need for mental health support remains a critical aspect of the healing process. Additionally, issues of justice, accountability, and the reintegration of former combatants into society pose ongoing challenges.  In conclusion, life in Rwanda 16 years after the genocide reflects a nation's determined effort to rise from the ashes of tragedy. The emphasis on unity, reconciliation, and economic development has paved the way for a more hopeful future. However, the journey is far from over, and Rwanda continues to navigate the complexities of post-genocide recovery. The story of Rwanda serves as a reminder of the human capacity for resilience and transformation, offering lessons for the global community on the possibilities of healing and rebuilding even in the face of unimaginable adversity.  SECTION 6  Journey of Zambia's President  In the heart of Southern Africa, a nation emerged from the shadows of adversity, guided by the visionary leadership of Zambia's President. His journey from a grassroots activist to the highest office in the land is an inspirational narrative that has revitalized the spirit of the Zambian people.  Born into humble beginnings, the president's early life mirrored the challenges faced by many in his nation. However, his insatiable thirst for knowledge became the compass guiding him through the maze of hardships. With a scholarship in hand, he pursued higher education, recognizing that education was not just a personal pursuit but a key to unlocking the potential of an entire nation.  As a young activist, he stood on the frontlines, advocating for social justice and economic empowerment. His unwavering commitment to the welfare of the people earned him the trust of communities grappling with poverty and inequality. It was this grassroots connection that would later define his presidency.  Assuming office during a period of economic uncertainty, the president faced a daunting task. Undeterred, he embarked on a mission to transform Zambia into a beacon of progress and inclusivity. His economic policies aimed at fostering growth while ensuring that the benefits reached even the remotest corners of the country.  One of the president's hallmark achievements was a comprehensive healthcare reform, recognizing that a healthy nation is a productive nation. Under his leadership, healthcare infrastructure saw unprecedented development, and initiatives were launched to address endemic diseases. The president's commitment to the well-being of every Zambian became a rallying cry for a healthier and more resilient nation.  In the realm of education, the president championed initiatives to increase access and improve the quality of learning. Recognizing that education is the cornerstone of progress, he implemented policies that encouraged innovation, technology adoption, and global collaboration. Schools became hubs of inspiration, nurturing the next generation of leaders and visionaries.  Yet, perhaps the most transformative aspect of the president's tenure was his dedication to fostering unity and inclusivity. He recognized the strength in diversity and tirelessly worked to bridge gaps, ensuring that every citizen, regardless of background, had a stake in Zambia's journey toward prosperity.  As the nation navigated global challenges, the president stood tall, a symbol of resilience and forward-thinking leadership. His ability to steer Zambia through turbulent waters, coupled with a commitment to ethical governance, earned him not just respect within the nation but admiration on the international stage.  The story of Zambia's president is a testament to the belief that transformative leadership is born from a deep understanding of the people's needs and an unwavering commitment to a shared vision. His journey inspires not just Zambians but serves as a beacon of hope for nations seeking progress, unity, and a brighter future under the guidance of visionary leadership. 121 - 02 Jan 2024 12:01PM - Gurvinder: *MBA in Finance* is among the most sought-after specialization in the field of Management. MBA (Finance) is a two-year postgraduate course. The course is best suited for those who wish to work in the financial sector such as insurance and mutual funds among others. MBA in Finance syllabus is formulated in such a way that, besides providing the knowledge of operational aspects of  finance, also builds and enhances the candidates managerial and technical skills.
122 - 02 Jan 2024 12:01PM - Gurvinder: Starting from the principles and practices of management to managerial economics and management of a bank, MBA in Finance is all-inclusive and well-rounded as far as the managerial and technical aspects in the financial sector are concerned.
123 - 02 Jan 2024 12:01PM - Gurvinder: *What is it About?*  The Management of Finance is a crucial aspect of any business and requires able and expertly trained professionals to determine the why and how aspect of funding and investment. Since no organization can function without professionals to make such calls, MBA in Finance will always remain an in-demand course.Some of the basic skills an MBA in Finance helps in building are:  *Investment Strategy* *Understanding of Local and Global Economy* *Merger and Acquisitions* *Corporate and Financial Risk Management* *Hedge Fund Management*  An MBA in Finance prepares an individual to for management level jobs in Banking and Finance Sector. Courses in MBA in Finance focus more on the managerial aspects of asset management. MBA in Finance is ideal for students who wish to secure managerial and leading positions in an organization. MBA in finance is the most popular stream in Management studies these days. Course structure and curriculum is something that plays a vital role for making it the most popular among MBA aspirants.

90 - 29 Dec 2023 12:43PM - Gurvinder: Chelsey, The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing  just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. B) 2       SECTION 5 ESSAY WRITING Write a short essay in about 500 words  TOPIC: What is life in Rwanda like 16 years after the genocide there?  16 years following the Rwandan genocide, survivors and their families continue to present with considerable rates of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substantial depressive and anxiety symptoms.   A study undertaken clearly showed that, genocide survivors showed high rates of mental health and psychosocial problems due to the inconceivable, dehumanized brutality that the majority of them had been exposed or witnessed. Entire family systems as well as the general social fabric that formerly provided support were destroyed due to losses of family members and growing mistrust and fear following the genocide. A great majority of the survivors were female and woman-headed households proved to be especially vulnerable, suffering from the effects of economic deprivation, which included a lack of food, housing and money for the education of their children. Apart from general population samples, studies analyzing the mental health situation in Rwanda following the genocide have mainly focused on groups of widows and orphans or children living in child-headed households. An elevated level of depressive and anxious symptoms as well as PTSD was found in each of these groups.  On the other hand, little to nothing is known about the mental health situation of former prisoners in Rwanda, many of which spent several years in refugee camps. It is assumed that former prisoners that is, accused perpetrators and their respective families also present mental health problems, due to their participation in or to the exposure to violence, genocide and their refugee status. A comparison of the physical and mental healthof the survivorsand the prisonersis necessary, as prisoners constitute important stakeholders within the post-conflict Rwandansociety and assumingly present with different mentalhealth and socioeconomic profiles. This also assumed that a neutral, unaffected group would be near impossible to find owing to the pervasive effects of violence on the Rwandan population as a whole. As the primary targets of genocidal acts were men and boys, genocide survivors proved to be mainly women, whereas genocide-related crimes were mainly committed by men hence a gender imbalance is therefore assumed in the present population. A further hypothesis points out that families of genocide survivors had been exposed to more traumatic events and that they were more affected in terms of mental and physical health.  A current study revealed data that showed a strong association betweenhealth problems and psychosocial factors such as socialintegration. A high level of PTSD in the group of formerprisoners, and thus the likely genocide perpetrators thatdemonstrated that psychological suffering affected thepopulation at large, although the nature of traumaticstressors may have varied. By challenging the question ofwho owns trauma discourses in a post-conflict societysuch as Rwanda, mental health services should take theneeds of the entire population into consideration when offering care. An idea that is still not mainstream in Rwanda.  Overally, the descendants of genocide survivors showed a higher risk for mental health problems than descendants of former prisoners. A high trauma load as well as missing family integration and support characterizes their specific vulnerable situation. Interventions and initiatives that stimulate reconciliation processes between future generations.                SECTION 6 PERSONALITY TEST "My Inspirational Story"   Growing up in a child-headed family, Silvester Sinclare had a tough upbringing in a deserted society where no relatives offered help to him and his older brother. His brother could not afford to go to school so he sacrifice to work for his brother to attend school.  With all the troubles and suffering he experienced through his life, he had a burning desire to succeed in the near future life so that he could take care of his brother. Being a kind-hearted person, Silvester also had the passion to work and develop the deserted society he grew up in. In studying he aimed for the farthest destinations in this infinite universe so that if he missed atleast he will shine brightly among the stars and be an example to the upcoming future generations. During his studies he believed that there is nothing known as luck, rather it is just a coincidence of events in a timeline as a result of hardwork. In several occasions he had to skip school and help his brother in working to get the school fees., but however this did not disturb his education as the results always said it loud and clear. He won several trophies in coming up as one of the best students of all times at the school.  When he completed his advanced level, he came up with a bright future that proved many people of the community that he was guaranteed for a brighter future than one which he grew up in. The problem that rose was that his brother could not pay the required amounts of fees for his tertiary education, but however, a coincidence of events occurred that lifted the pressure from his brothers shoulders as he had passed his advanced level with flying colors. Silvester received an apprenticeship from the government which allowed him to study the desired program at tertiary education at any school that was best suited his interests. Silvester chose to pursue a career in chartered accountanting at tertiary level and he came out as the best student from the overall assessment made. A day after his graduation ceremony where he got a degree in chartered accountancy and business management, several companies were already offering work to Silvester with different guarantees covering housing, food and transport and with good payments.  After the completion of his goals,Silvester shone brightly among the stars a light the path of the young people in studying. He took care of his brother and begun rebuilding the broken and deserted community and made sure that the lives of the community members prospered. His community honoured him for his great work and set motto which read; 'when everything seems lost, only hope remains', for there is light at the end of every dark tunnel.

On the other hand, little to nothing is known about the mental health situation of former prisoners in Rwanda, many of which spent several years in refugee camps. It is assumed that former prisoners that is, accused perpetrators and their respective families also present mental health problems, due to their participation in or to the exposure to violence, genocide and their refugee status. A comparison of the physical and mental healthof the survivorsand the prisonersis necessary, as prisoners constitute important stakeholders within the post-conflict Rwandansociety and assumingly present with different mentalhealth and socioeconomic profiles. This also assumed that a neutral, unaffected group would be near impossible to find owing to the pervasive effects of violence on the Rwandan population as a whole. As the primary targets of genocidal acts were men and boys, genocide survivors proved to be mainly women, whereas genocide-related crimes were mainly committed by men hence a gender imbalance is therefore assumed in the present population. A further hypothesis points out that families of genocide survivors had been exposed to more traumatic events and that they were more affected in terms of mental and physical health.  A current study revealed data that showed a strong association betweenhealth problems and psychosocial factors such as socialintegration. A high level of PTSD in the group of formerprisoners, and thus the likely genocide perpetrators thatdemonstrated that psychological suffering affected thepopulation at large, although the nature of traumaticstressors may have varied. By challenging the question ofwho owns trauma discourses in a post-conflict societysuch as Rwanda, mental health services should take theneeds of the entire population into consideration when offering care. An idea that is still not mainstream in Rwanda.  Overally, the descendants of genocide survivors showed a higher risk for mental health problems than descendants of former prisoners. A high trauma load as well as missing family integration and support characterizes their specific vulnerable situation. Interventions and initiatives that stimulate reconciliation processes between future generations.                SECTION 6 PERSONALITY TEST "My Inspirational Story"   Growing up in a child-headed family, Silvester Sinclare had a tough upbringing in a deserted society where no relatives offered help to him and his older brother. His brother could not afford to go to school so he sacrifice to work for his brother to attend school.  With all the troubles and suffering he experienced through his life, he had a burning desire to succeed in the near future life so that he could take care of his brother. Being a kind-hearted person, Silvester also had the passion to work and develop the deserted society he grew up in. In studying he aimed for the farthest destinations in this infinite universe so that if he missed atleast he will shine brightly among the stars and be an example to the upcoming future generations. During his studies he believed that there is nothing known as luck, rather it is just a coincidence of events in a timeline as a result of hardwork. In several occasions he had to skip school and help his brother in working to get the school fees., but however this did not disturb his education as the results always said it loud and clear. He won several trophies in coming up as one of the best students of all times at the school.  When he completed his advanced level, he came up with a bright future that proved many people of the community that he was guaranteed for a brighter future than one which he grew up in. The problem that rose was that his brother could not pay the required amounts of fees for his tertiary education, but however, a coincidence of events occurred that lifted the pressure from his brothers shoulders as he had passed his advanced level with flying colors. Silvester received an apprenticeship from the government which allowed him to study the desired program at tertiary education at any school that was best suited his interests. Silvester chose to pursue a career in chartered accountanting at tertiary level and he came out as the best student from the overall assessment made. A day after his graduation ceremony where he got a degree in chartered accountancy and business management, several companies were already offering work to Silvester with different guarantees covering housing, food and transport and with good payments.  After the completion of his goals,Silvester shone brightly among the stars a light the path of the young people in studying. He took care of his brother and begun rebuilding the broken and deserted community and made sure that the lives of the community members prospered. His community honoured him for his great work and set motto which read; 'when everything seems lost, only hope remains', for there is light at the end of every dark tunnel.

238 - 02 Jan 2024 10:01AM - Gurvinder: Precious basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*

22 - 02 Jan 2024 11:52AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
23 - 02 Jan 2024 11:52AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. 24 - 02 Jan 2024 11:52AM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. 66 - 02 Jan 2024 03:01PM - Gurvinder: *B.A. (Hons.) in Sociology* is an undergraduate program that deals with various aspects of social behavior and its consequence on modern society. Sociology is a branch of study which investigates multiple aspects of society and social behavior which helps them to do social work. A Bachelor's degree in Sociology teaches the fundamental concepts related to the structure of society, organization of society, and how humans interact within these constructs. The basic subject matter of Sociology concerns itself with topics related to family structure, global warfare, religious cults, social class, race, and gender, etc.
67 - 02 Jan 2024 03:01PM - Gurvinder: *Course Outline*  This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. Opportunities also exist for sociology graduates in the civil service and graduate management training schemes. 64 - 02 Jan 2024 06:16PM - Harmehak: Actually you are mistaken over here, let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.

60 - 02 Jan 2024 04:10PM - Kunal: *Bsc in Optometry is a 4 year course*  Bachelor of Optometry is an undergraduate program concerning eye care. Optometry is the science of eye care including eye examination, diagnosis, treatment and management of diseases and disorders of the visual system. It is a vision care science. Bachelor of Optometry is a four-year course containing three years of learning and a year of internship in clinical experience.  It can also be defined as the science of eye equipment (including lenses and spectacles) aimed at improving the vision of the human eye. This involves removal of all kinds of obstacles of sight which an individual may suffer from. This is a dynamic and challenging career, which allows one to nurse people, achieve personal growth, community respect, job flexibility and financial stability.  The core training and practical exposure offered in the course is designed to prepare eligible candidates for providing competent services in capacities such as Optician, Optometrist, Refractionist and Ophthalmic Assistant. A graduate of this stream can serve the community in urban, semi-urban and rural settings in private, semi-governmental and governmental sectors.  Optics is the branch of science involving the structure, function, and operation of the human eye. Optometrists are health professionals who have specialized in eye care. They deal with eye testing and provide solutions to patients suffering from vision disorders such as partial sight, hereditary vision defects, squint, weakening of eye muscles etc. They suggest alternate vision aids such as spectacles or contact lenses.  They also provide preoperative and postoperative care to individual suffering from cataract. Often optometrists discover eye conditions caused by systemic problems, such as diabetes or high blood pressure, and refer their patients to other medical doctors. Since the eye is one of the most important human organs, optometrists are offered a wide range of lucrative career options both in India and abroad, assigned the responsibility of leading others from darkness to light, literally.
61 - 02 Jan 2024 04:11PM - Kunal: *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 4-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system. In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases. The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* -BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. -Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues. -With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body. -This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. -Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?* -BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  -With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. -Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments. -With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. -The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.  *What are the Career Options and Job Profiles Available After Completing a BSc Cardiovascular Technology?* -There are a large number of job options available to BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders. Some of the prominent ones are given below:  -Upon completion of this degree, students can work in Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc. as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologists, Medical Sonographers etc. There are a large number of private and government organizations which offer jobs to BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders.  *Job Profiles* 1. Cardiovascular Technologist-A Cardiovascular Technologist is responsible for various activities with respect to monitoring and carrying out various tests on patients with issues related to the heart and the circulatory system. They also handle and maintain the equipment, maintain documents, do the necessary paperwork and keep a tab on the patients condition.  2.Cardiac Sonographers-A Cardiac Sonographer uses the facility of ultrasound for examining valves, vessels and the heart chambers. Through images called echocardiograms, they assess the functioning of the heart. They also assist the cardiac specialist in placing a tube in the esophagus of a patient for obtaining ultrasound images.  3.Vascular Technologist -Vascular Technologists or Specialists help physicians in diagnosing disorders in the circulatory system. They listen to vascular flow sounds and evaluate parameters such as blood flow rate in the arteries and the veins and the pulse rate. They also carry out tests to determine parameters such as blood pressure, oxygen saturation, vascular blood flow, etc.  4.EKG Technician-EKG Technicians are cardiovascular technicians who perform tests such as electrocardiograph. They attach electrodes at various locations on the body such as arms, legs and chest of the patient. The interpretation about the test report is however done by the physicians. Some of the technicians are also capable of setting up Holter monitors.  5.Echocardiographic Technician-Also termed as Echo-Technicians are specialised in forming the images of a patients heart through echocardiography. They assist cardiologists to come up with the right diagnosis. etc

Bachelor of Optometry is a four-year course containing three years of learning and a year of internship in clinical experience. They deal with eye testing and provide solutions to patients suffering from vision disorders such as partial sight, hereditary vision defects, squint, weakening of eye muscles etc. They suggest alternate vision aids such as spectacles or contact lenses. 88 - 02 Jan 2024 03:03PM - Kunal: *Bachelor of Commerce (B.com)* is a three year long undergraduate course that is evenly distributed into 6 half-yearly semesters.  A high number of jobs are available for B.com graduates in industries such as Information Technology, Manufacturing, Telecommunications and Banking.The most sought after B.Com. jobs are Financial Manger, Accountant, Lecturer, Chartered Accountant, Human Resource Development etc.  The 3 year B.com degree program aims to facilitate a deep understanding of how business organizations work. It develops knowledge and skills in core B.com subjects like Accounting, Finance, Banking & Insurance, Marketing, Human Resources and Taxation. The entire B.com syllabus is designed in a manner which develops competency in students, allowing them to pursue higher level programs. It also increases practical knowledge and employability.  The subjects included in B.com program are as following:  *Accountancy* *Cost Account* *Statistics* *Management* *Human Resource* *Computer* *Economics* *English* *Law* *Marketing* *Finance*   After being awarded the B.Com degree, candidates can either look for jobs in various departments or opt for higher education.  *B.Com graduates can pursue post-graduation courses such as M.Com (Master of Commerce), MBA (Master of Business Administration), CA (Chartered Accountant), CS (Company Secretary), Actuarial Scientist, and ACCA (Association of Chartered Accountants).*  *B.Com graduates have a plethora of job positions in government as well as private sectors to choose from provided that they are not limited to careers in accounts and finance*

36 - 02 Jan 2024 04:15PM - Pallika Edoofa: *The Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4,000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5,000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
37 - 02 Jan 2024 04:15PM - Pallika Edoofa: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabwe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominics Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries, and many others. In Manicaland, we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. Davids Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice, and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, You would be happy to know that the DEOs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo has 24 Schools that collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antonys, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High, and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke. We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central, and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo add a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.    The Schools, Institutions, and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized designers of EDOOFA in Zimbabwe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), and Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud Zimbabwean students and parents community of more than 2500 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.  *I believe you are looking forward to such an opportunity for your career, aren't you?*

68 - 02 Jan 2024 10:36AM - Pallika Edoofa: Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences:  The Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences is a dynamic program that delves into the intersection of biology and medicine, providing students with a solid foundation in understanding the human body's intricate mechanisms and the scientific basis of various diseases. This interdisciplinary field explores topics such as genetics, biochemistry, microbiology, and pharmacology, preparing students for a range of careers in healthcare and research.  Duration: Typically spanning three to four years, the duration of a Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences program may vary based on the institution and its curriculum.  Job Opportunities: Graduates with a degree in Biomedical Sciences have diverse career opportunities, including roles such as Research Scientist, Clinical Laboratory Technologist, Pharmaceutical Sales Representative, Biomedical Technician, and Medical Writer. The program equips students with skills that are applicable in various sectors, including healthcare, pharmaceuticals, research, and diagnostics.  Who Should Opt: Individuals with a keen interest in understanding the intricacies of human biology, diseases, and medical advancements are well-suited for a Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Sciences. This program is ideal for those who aspire to contribute to the fields of healthcare and research, possess a curiosity for scientific exploration, and are passionate about improving human health.  Choosing Biomedical Sciences is advantageous for individuals who envision themselves at the forefront of medical discoveries, innovations, and solutions that impact the well-being of individuals and communities.

127 - 02 Jan 2024 11:41AM - Pallika Edoofa: Alright, Please let me explain to you when and why the enrollment fee is paid.
128 - 02 Jan 2024 11:41AM - Pallika Edoofa: This enrollment fee is to be paid only if a student qualifies for the Edoofa program and includes your *-Application Forms to multiple Universities prepared by our Academic Team* *-Statement of Purpose for Multiple Universities* *-Earn While You Learn Program and training* *-University sessions and interactions* *-A guaranteed scholarship seat* *-Visa Documentation Assistance* *The Foster and Care throughout your course*
129 - 02 Jan 2024 11:41AM - Pallika Edoofa: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is *found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.*
130 - 02 Jan 2024 11:42AM - Pallika Edoofa: Basically, there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.   *Phase 1*: Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.   *Phase 2*: Once the students complete Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-level result is out).   *Phase 3*: Once the final A-level results are out if the student has passed the necessary requirements as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission will be continued. However, if the student doesn't meet the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the $350 would be refunded to the parents.   *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*

I feel in Zambia, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zambia has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zambian families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

18 - 02 Jan 2024 01:44PM - +263 77 289 2775: Admission Process 1. In the first step, the students have to receive proper information about the Edoofa program so that they understand the unique benefits and the value what we are doing for them. (This step happens when students are in Africa and can happen on either call, WhatsApp, email or any other online medium.) 2. In the second step, Edoofa eligibility check is done and interview is taken. (This also happens while the students are in Africa.) Once the students are found eligible by evaluating their transcripts/grades and performance in the interview, they are offered the chance of enrolment in the Edoofa program 3. The third step is the Acceptance Letter from Edoofa, in this step if you manage to clear the Interview Process, then you get selected into our Program and get an Acceptance Letter from Edoofa 4. The fourth Step involves finalizing your enrolment into the Edoofa Program by completing our Edoofa Enrolment Fee formalities (fee ranges from $350-$750 depending upon the admission cycle): Once the student pays the registration fee, Edoofa helps in generating the Admission Acceptance Letter (AAL) from the University/college as well as the visa letter which Edoofa also helps in mailing to the Indian High Commission in the particular country for the purpose of Visa. All the necessary help and information regarding the Visa process will be provided by the Edoofa Admission officers at the stage . 5.In the Fifth Step, once the enrolment is completed, our students rely on the full-fledged support provided by our admission officers. No other college or programme has this level of conviction towards comforting the students and providing a wonderful experience to them. To get admission via our scholarship fund. (This process also happens while the students remain in their home country and they are directly going to be connecting with University representatives.). Once the university sessions are over, students secure the Admission offer letter (LOI) from the respective universities based on Edoofa's recommendation and then the student is expected to pay Registration fees (ranging from $500-$750) to confirm their admission with in a stipulated time frame. 6. In the Sixth Step, once the student pays the registration fee, Edoofa helps in generating the Admission Acceptance Letter (AAL) from the University/college as well as the visa letter. Edoofa also guides in the mailing process to the Indian High Commission in the particular country for the purpose of Visa. All the necessary help and information regarding the Visa process will be provided by the Edoofa Admission officers at this stage.

We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. 46 - 02 Jan 2024 02:01PM - Sahil Edoofa: So now shall I brief you about *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor in Legislative Law*?
47 - 02 Jan 2024 02:01PM - +27 67 102 6447: Okay I hear you
48 - 02 Jan 2024 02:02PM - Sahil Edoofa: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures.  In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues.  *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream.  *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills.  A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are:  *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations.  The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates.  *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their clients perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court.  *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor.  *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job.  *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding.  A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.  *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on  going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are:  *Good Written Communication* Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency.  *Good Verbal Communication* A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law.  *Good Time Management* In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential.  *A great degree of self-confidence* This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases.  *An analytical mind and good research skills* A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success.  *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)* Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic.  *Tech Savvy* In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success.  *Good Commercial awareness* This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally.  *A high degree of patience* This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling.  *Team player skills* Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information though networking and working with people helps in attaining the objectives.

91 - 02 Jan 2024 03:05PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: BSc Cardiovascular Technology  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues.  With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body.   This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments.   With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

559 - 02 Jan 2024 11:06AM - Shubham Madhwal: Visa fees and flight tickets are to be bought just a month before they plan to come to India.
